title: Oil Prices Slide as Investors Worry Energy Demand Is Slowing
description: The U.S. benchmark oil price fell below $80 a barrel on Friday, and gasoline prices in some states are now close to $3 a gallon.

title: US Backs Immunity for Saudi Leader in Lawsuit Over Khashoggi Murder
description: The State Department said Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, the kingdom’s de facto ruler, should have legal immunity as the head of the Saudi government.

title: Rishi Sunak, With Elite Pedigree, Must Now Sell Britain on Austerity
description: The country’s new prime minister must now persuade ordinary Britons that they should support his government through a painful ordeal of tax increases, spending cuts and a recession.

title: Split Between Rich and Poor Nations Deadlocks Climate Talks
description: Debate intensified over a contentious issue — the creation of a fund to help poor and vulnerable countries pay for “loss and damage” caused by climate change.

title: Deadly Blaze in Gaza Strip Kills 21 People Gathered for a Family Party
description: The fast-moving blaze and the high number of deaths led to accusations that emergency units were too slow in responding.

title: Griner Enters a Penal Colony, Russia Signals Openness to Prisoner Swap
description: Russia reiterated its openness to a prisoner exchange with the United States involving the notorious convicted arms dealer Viktor Bout.

title: How Was Russia Able to Launch Its Biggest Aerial Attack on Ukraine?
description: Western and Ukrainian officials have said Moscow’s stockpile of missiles was dwindling. But the assaults this week raise questions about that.

title: Taking on the Climate
description: International climate summits are imperfect, but they have led to real progress.

title: A Beloved Show Gets Another Life
description: The unexpected revival of “Neighbours,” the long-running drama that offered a sweet, uncontroversial vision of Australia, comes via Amazon. Will streaming change its nature?

title: Both Sides Adapt Battlefield Strategy in East for Winter
description: Ukraine has pressed its counteroffensive in Luhansk, though fighting there has slowed.

title: Anton Filatov, Ukrainian Film Critic, Drafted Into Real-Life War
description: Anton Filatov was pulled into a theater he never expected or wanted to enter: the front lines of war, where he now writes movingly of the scene in the trenches instead of what’s on the screen.

title: In France, Victims’ Fund Struggles to Heal Terrorism’s Traumas
description: At the trial over the 2016 terrorist attack in Nice, bereaved family members and survivors vent frustration at a cumbersome process to obtain compensation.

title: The End of Covid Vaccines at ‘Warp Speed’
description: Financial and bureaucratic barriers in the United States mean that the next generation of Covid vaccines may well be designed here, but used elsewhere.

title: US Backs Immunity for Saudi Leader in Lawsuit Over Khashoggi Murder
description: The State Department said Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, the kingdom’s de facto ruler, should have legal immunity as the head of the Saudi government.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: Three men have been found guilty of the downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 and the murder of the 298 people onboard.

title: Corrections: Nov. 18, 2022
description: Corrections that appeared in print on Friday, Nov. 18, 2022.

title: North Korea Appears to Have Launched Another ICBM, South Says
description: If confirmed, it would be the North’s second test of an intercontinental ballistic missile this month.
